data.title: OCDP Clubs
data.meta_description: Scroll down to see your club's listing or click here for a spreadsheet of all clubs. All club meetings are free and open to the public. What is a Democratic Club? A Democratic Club is an official association of local Democrats who come together to discuss, debate, and work to promote Democratic candidates and legislation in their city, town, neighborhood, or region.
data.text:
Scroll down to see your club's listing or click here for a spreadsheet of all clubs. All club meetings are free and open to the public.

What is a Democratic Club?

A Democratic Club is an official association of local Democrats who come together to discuss, debate, and work to promote Democratic candidates and legislation in their city, town, neighborhood, or region.

The Oakland County Democratic Party (OCDP) works to ensure that every Oakland County Democrat is served by a visible, organized, broadly-based geographic Democratic club that reaches out year-round to its community; recruits quality Democratic candidates for every appointed and elected position in its purview; and supports those officials in advocating for Democratic Party values both as candidates and in their sworn public roles.

The OCDP helps Democratic clubs to communicate their policy messages and positions on issues in a democratic manner and at the appropriate level to provide information and guidance to appointed and elected officials and candidates.

Clubs:

Birmingham Bloomfield Area Democratic Club

Cities/Townships: Birmingham, Bloomfield Hills, Bloomfield Township, Southfield Township (Beverly Hills, Bingham Farms, and Franklin)

Chair: Debbie Rosenman

Email: chair@bbdems.org

Website

Facebook

Meeting Schedule: 3rd Tuesday of the month, 6:30-8:30pm, Bloomfield Twp. Hall

OCDP Executive Committee Members: Debbie Rosenman, Corinne Shoop, Richard Grinstein, Nessa Feller, Larry Lipton, Lisa Peers, Ralph Plumley, Kari Zhao, Mike Corbin
